terms.definition: Product Requirements Document - an internal document that outlines what a product should accomplish for users without defining specific implementation details
A centralized repository of information, documentation, and resources that provides self-service support to users
A support model where customers can find answers and solve problems independently without contacting support staff
Written materials that explain how to use, install, configure, or develop technical products and systems
The visual elements and interactive components through which users interact with a software application or system
Search Engine Optimization - the practice of improving content and websites to increase visibility in search engine results
Search Engine Results Pages - the pages displayed by search engines in response to a user's query
A lightweight markup language that uses plain text formatting syntax to create structured documents
A system that tracks and manages changes to documents or code over time, allowing rollback to previous versions
Enhanced search results that display additional information like ratings, images, or structured data beyond basic text
Unique Selling Points - distinctive features or benefits that differentiate a product from competitors
Customer Experience - the overall perception and interaction a customer has with a company across all touchpoints
The consistent personality and style of communication used in written content to reflect brand character
The process of adapting content, products, or services to meet the language, cultural, and regional requirements of specific markets
Brief HTML attributes that summarize webpage content and appear in search engine results below the page title
